title: 5 years after COVID, new epidemic in China which affecting children and elderly - The Times of India
summary:
5 years after COVID, new epidemic in China which affecting children and elderly

Date: October 2023

Source: The Times of India

This article discusses the rise of respiratory illnesses in China, including influenza A and hMPV, primarily affecting children and the elderly. This increase is related to colder weather and the return to normal life post-COVID.

  • Respiratory illnesses are notably affecting children and the elderly due to seasonal changes and increased social interactions.
  • No formal alerts or declarations of emergencies have been issued by health authorities.
  • Rumors of overwhelmed hospitals are unsubstantiated and lack credible evidence.
  • The increase in cases is mostly seasonal and not indicative of a new pandemic.
  • Good hygiene practices and staying home when sick are recommended to prevent the spread.
Respiratory illnesses, including hMPV, are rising, particularly affecting children and the elderly, due to post-COVID factors and colder weather.

In conclusion, while there is a rise in respiratory illnesses, it remains a seasonal spike, and individuals are encouraged to maintain hygiene and health practices to mitigate risks.
newTitle: New Respiratory Illness Surge in China Post-COVID

Quadrantid Meteor Shower: First 'shooting stars' of 2025 – when and where to watch - India Today
summary:
Quadrantid Meteor Shower: First 'shooting stars' of 2025 – when and where to watch

Published On: Jan 3, 2025

Source: indiastodayglobal

The Quadrantid meteor shower will peak on January 3, 2025, offering the first major celestial event of the year with a potential display of up to 200 meteors per hour in optimal conditions.

  • The meteor shower is active from December 26, 2024, to January 16, 2025.
  • Best viewing time is in the early morning hours before dawn on January 3.
  • Ideal viewing conditions include dark, clear skies away from city lights, particularly in the Northern Hemisphere.
  • NASA emphasizes the importance of allowing your eyes to adjust to darkness for the best experience.
“The sight of these large, colourful explosions of light will be a stunning way to start your year.”

Don't miss the chance to observe this beautiful astronomical event, ensuring you have the best conditions to enjoy the stunning display of meteors.
newTitle: Quadrantid Meteor Shower: First 'shooting stars' of 2025 – when and where to watch

title: HMPV: The mysterious virus gripping China — What You Need to Know - CNBCTV18
summary:
HMPV: The Mysterious Virus Gripping China

Publication Date: March 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

China is currently facing an outbreak of the human metapneumovirus (HMPV), which causes flu-like symptoms and primarily affects vulnerable populations such as children and the elderly.

  • The HMPV outbreak is raising concerns in several regions of China, five years after COVID-19 surfaced.
  • The virus is an RNA virus first identified in 2001 and has been observed globally as a respiratory pathogen.
  • Transmission occurs through droplets and close contact, with symptoms resembling the common cold.
  • The virus can lead to severe respiratory issues like bronchitis and pneumonia, particularly in at-risk individuals.
  • China's CDC has issued recommendations including mask-wearing and good hygiene practices.
  • Laboratory protocols for case reporting and verification are being established to monitor the situation.
  • Recent data shows a rise in respiratory infections linked to HMPV, especially among children under 14 in northern provinces.
“Data from Dec 16-22 indicates a rise in acute respiratory infections, including HMPV, particularly in northern provinces.”

The situation with HMPV underscores the importance of readiness and response to respiratory outbreaks, with lessons learned from the COVID-19 pandemic informing current measures.
newTitle: HMPV: The Mysterious Virus Gripping China

title: Elon Musk is standing in the way as Jeff Bezos reaches for orbit - Financial Times

summary:
Musk is Standing in the Way as Bezos Reaches for Orbit

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Financial Times

This article discusses Jeff Bezos’s Blue Origin as it attempts to launch a rocket into orbit, a pivotal moment in the private space race against Elon Musk’s SpaceX, which has seen considerable success.

  • Blue Origin has faced delays and is attempting to launch its orbital rocket, New Glenn.
  • The private space race sees competition intensifying between Bezos and Musk.
  • Musk’s political influence and the growing costs in space exploration pose challenges for Bezos.
  • Expectation that the demand for launches will exceed supply through the rest of the decade.
  • Governments face a new challenge in controlling a space business that is dominated by wealthy individuals.
“The demand for space launches is expected to far exceed supply for the rest of this decade.”

This event marks a significant turning point in private space exploration, with implications for both business and politics as rival billionaires push the boundaries of space travel.
newTitle: Musk is Standing in the Way as Bezos Reaches for Orbit

The horror comedy universe expands with new sequels and spin-offs, generating excitement among fans.

  • 'Thama' will kick off the series in 2025, with notable stars Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna.

summary:
Jennifer Lopez relates to her Unstoppable character Judy Robles, sharing similarities in their challenging relationships amid split with Ben Affleck.

Date: Jan 02, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a new interview, Jennifer Lopez revealed that she strongly found her character from Unstoppable, Judy Robles’s “challenging relationships” relatable. She mentioned a connection with her character amidst her divorce from Ben Affleck.

  • Lopez described shared experiences with Judy Robles, emphasizing their Latina backgrounds and motherhood.
  • Amid her divorce, she appreciates the strength that relationships require.
  • Despite the split, Lopez and Affleck maintain a cooperative relationship for their families.

title: Karnataka: Woman kills husband, smashes his face with stone, chops body - Hindustan Times
summary:
Woman Arrested for Murdering Husband, Disposing Body in Karnataka

Date: Jan 02, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

A woman in Karnataka's Belagavi was arrested for allegedly murdering her husband and chopping his body, police said on Thursday.

  • The woman allegedly strangled her 40-year-old husband, identified as Srimantha Itnali, and then smashed his face with a stone.
  • She cut his body into two pieces to dispose of it away from her house.
  • The incident took place on December 8, and the body was found on December 10 in Umarani village in Chikkodi taluk of Belagavi.
  • The police initially did not suspect the woman, but later brought her in for questioning, and she confessed to the crime.
  • The husband was reportedly a drunkard who abused his wife for money and wanted her to sell a piece of land to buy him a new motorbike.
"She first strangled him and when he was unconscious, used a boulder lying nearby to smash his face. She then disposed of the boulder in a well."

The woman has been taken into custody.
newTitle: Woman Arrested for Murdering Husband, Disposing Body in Karnataka

summary:
Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Champion Athletes Selected For Khel Ratna Award

Published on: January 02, 2025, 21:01 IST | Source: News18

The Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports has announced the National Sports Awards 2024, honoring Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh, Harmanpreet Singh, and Praveen Kumar with the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award.

  • Ministry announced the awards on January 02, 2025.
  • Manu Bhaker is the first athlete from independent India to win two medals in a single Olympics.
  • D Gukesh became the youngest World champion and helped the Indian team win gold at the Chess Olympiad.
  • Harmanpreet Singh led the Indian hockey team to a bronze medal and Praveen Kumar was crowned T64 champion in para athletics.
  • The awards ceremony will be held on January 17, 2025, at Rashtrapati Bhavan.
"The awardees will receive their awards from the President of India."

The recognition of these athletes highlights their contributions and achievements in Indian sports, inspiring future generations.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Champion Athletes Selected For Khel Ratna Award

title: 10 after-dinner rituals that can help in digestion, prevent bloating - The Times of India
summary:
10 After-Dinner Rituals to Enhance Digestion and Prevent Bloating

Publication Date: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: Times of India

Implementing certain after-dinner rituals can significantly improve digestion and prevent bloating, ensuring a healthier gut.

  • Consume probiotics like yogurt or kefir.
  • Chew fennel seeds for their natural digestive qualities.
  • Take a light 10-15 minute walk after dinner for better digestion.
  • Drink warm water or herbal teas such as ginger or peppermint.
  • Stay hydrated throughout the day, but avoid large quantities of water immediately post-meal.
  • Engage in gentle stretches like yoga to relieve tension.
  • Avoid lying down for at least 2-3 hours after eating.
  • Massage your abdomen to stimulate digestion.
  • Choose light desserts with fruit or dark chocolate to satisfy cravings without overloading the digestive system.
“Every little effort put in can be rewarded with a healthy gut and overall fitness.”

Carefully incorporating these rituals into daily life can lead to improved digestive health and overall well-being.
newTitle: 10 After-Dinner Rituals to Enhance Digestion and Prevent Bloating

title: Article 370 caused spread of terrorism in Kashmir: Amit Shah - The Hindu
summary:
Amit Shah: Article 370 Fueled Terrorism in Kashmir

Published on: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Union Home Minister Amit Shah claims that Article 370 has played a critical role in fostering terrorism in Kashmir, attributing it to the notion of temporary relations between Kashmir and India.

  • Article 370 fostered separatism among Kashmiri youth, leading to terrorism.
  • Other Muslim-majority regions in India did not experience similar terrorism despite sharing borders with Pakistan.
  • Mr. Shah stated that the misconception of Kashmir's relationship with India promoted extremism.
  • The revocation of Article 370 on August 5, 2019, must be understood in the larger historical context.

“Why did terrorism not spread in other Muslim areas of the country? ... It is unfortunate that 40,000 people lost their lives,” Mr. Shah said.

The Home Minister further emphasized the importance of re-evaluating Kashmir's history and offered perspectives that could reshape national narratives.
newTitle: Amit Shah: Article 370 Fueled Terrorism in Kashmir

Jurassic Park in real life? Hundreds of dinosaur footprints unearthed in UK's Oxfordshire | Today News - Mint
summary:
Jurassic Park in Real Life? Hundreds of Dinosaur Footprints Unearthed in UK’s Oxfordshire

Date: January 2, 2025
Source: Live Mint

In an astonishing revelation that feels straight out of a Jurassic Park film, researchers have unearthed hundreds of dinosaur footprints in a quarry in Oxfordshire, southern England. Dating back approximately 166 million years, these footprints provide a fascinating glimpse into the prehistoric world of giant reptiles.

  • The discovery was made at Dewars Farm Quarry by palaeontologists from the Universities of Oxford and Birmingham.
  • Five extensive trackways were found, with one stretching over 150 metres.
  • Four trackways belong to colossal sauropods, likely Cetiosaurus, which could reach lengths of up to 18 metres.
  • The fifth trackway belonged to the carnivore Megalosaurus, identifiable by its three-toed prints.
  • The interaction between different dinosaur species raises intriguing questions for researchers.
“Scientists have been studying Megalosaurus for longer than any other dinosaur on Earth, and yet these recent findings prove there is still new evidence waiting to be uncovered.” - Emma Nicholls

The footprints were discovered by quarry worker Gary Johnson, leading to a week-long excavation that revealed around 200 footprints. This find enhances our understanding of dinosaur behaviors and interactions, indicating ongoing excitement in palaeontological research in the UK.
newTitle: Jurassic Park in Real Life? Dinosaur Footprints Discovered in Oxfordshire

title: A timeline: IDF special op. against Iranian missile production facility in Syria - The Jerusalem Post
summary:
IDF's Special Operation Against Iranian Missile Facility: A Comprehensive Overview

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 Source: Jerusalem Post

The article discusses the IDF's planning and execution of a military operation aimed at destroying an underground Iranian missile production facility in Syria, detailing the timeline and challenges faced leading up to the operation.

  • Initial planning for the operation began in August 2024.
  • The operation took place on September 8, 2024.
  • The facility was first conceptualized by Iran in 2017 and began construction shortly thereafter.
  • IDF sources indicated there were doubts about the feasibility of such an operation.
  • High-quality intelligence collection was crucial to shifting perspectives on the operation's viability.
"Many top officials were initially not convinced that such an operation would be possible."

The operation illustrates the complexities involved in addressing threats from underground military installations and showcases the IDF's strategic evolution over time in tackling such challenges.
newTitle: IDF's Special Operation Against Iranian Missile Facility: A Comprehensive Overview

title: From meteor shower to comet: Astronomical events to look forward to in Jan 2025 - The Times of India
summary:
Astronomical Events to Look Forward to in January 2025

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: Unknown

January 2025 brings a dazzling lineup of astronomical events that will captivate both avid sky-watchers and casual stargazers.

  • January 3: Venus and Moon conjunction visible after sunset.
  • January 3-4: Quadrantid Meteor Shower peaks with 60 to 200 meteors per hour.
  • January 4: Occultation of Saturn by the Moon observable in select locations.
  • January 4: Earth at Perihelion, closest point to the Sun.
  • January 9-10: Venus reaches its greatest elongation.
  • January 13: Wolf Moon, marking the full moon of January.
  • January 16: Mars at opposition, appearing brighter in the sky.
  • January 29: New Moon, ideal for stargazing.
"January’s full moon, known as Wolf Moon, has great cultural significance for many cultures."

In summary, this January offers numerous celestial events that provide excellent opportunities for stargazing and appreciating the wonders of our universe.
newTitle: Astronomical Events to Look Forward to in January 2025

title: Theory of relativity, quantum physics key to explaining Big Bang, says scientist - The Hindu
summary:
Theory of relativity, quantum physics key to explaining Big Bang, says scientist

Published: January 02, 2025, Source: The Hindu

A combination of Albert Einstein’s theory of relativity and quantum physics may help explain the expansion of the universe from a singular entity, according to P. Ajith, an astrophysicist with the International Centre for Theoretical Sciences in Bengaluru. He presented this topic during a lecture at the Regional Science Centre and Planetarium in Kozhikode.

  • The primordial atom theory, proposed by Georges Lemaitre, is more of a narrative than a scientific fact.
  • History of cosmic understanding spans from Copernicus to Newton, shaping modern science and technology.
  • Einstein’s theory redefined gravity as a consequence of space-time effects rather than a force.
“The primordial atom is just a way of explaining what might have happened. To understand what happened then, we need to combine Einstein’s theory of relativity with quantum physics.” - P. Ajith

The integration of these scientific principles might offer profound insights into the universe's origins and evolution, highlighting the importance of continued exploration in physics.
newTitle: Key Insights on Big Bang Explained Through Relativity and Quantum Physics

title: Gautam Gambhir turns down request to 'allow Rohit Sharma to play in Sydney and retire' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gautam Gambhir Rejects Rohit Sharma's Playing Request Ahead of Sydney Test

Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent turn of events, Gautam Gambhir has opted not to include Rohit Sharma in the playing XI for the final Test against Australia, prioritizing team performance over individual requests.

  • Rohit Sharma, amidst poor performance, decided to 'opt out' of the playing XI.
  • His performance in the series has been subpar, averaging just 6.20.
  • Shubman Gill is set to replace Rohit in Sydney, while KL Rahul will open the innings.
  • Gambhir's decision is influenced by the need for a win to bolster India's chances in the World Test Championship.
  • An influential cricket administrator requested Gambhir allow Rohit to play and retire on-field, which he declined.
“Everything is fine with Rohit. The head coach is there. That should be fine.” – Gautam Gambhir

The decision emphasizes Gambhir's commitment to team success as India eyes the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and a spot in the World Test Championship final.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Rejects Rohit Sharma's Playing Request Ahead of Sydney Test

title: Hindenburg Research claims used-car dealer Carvana's involvement in $800 million loan sales undisclosed transactions | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Hindenburg Research Accuses Carvana of $800 Million Loan Misconduct

Published on: January 2, 2024, Source: Live Mint

US-based short seller Hindenburg Research has alleged that Carvana Co., an online car dealer, engaged in $800 million of loan sales involving undisclosed related party transactions. Following the report's release, Carvana's stock dropped nearly 5%.

Key Points:

  • Hindenburg's report claims $800 million in undisclosed loan sales by Carvana.
  • The report suggests accounting manipulation and lax underwriting practices.
  • Despite bankruptcy risks in previous years, Carvana's stock surged 284% in 2024.
  • Used vehicle prices have dropped 20.3% over the past three years, creating significant headwinds for Carvana.
  • The company's solvency is questioned due to insider stock unloading.
“For every $1 in net income it reported, the company has added $139 in market cap – a $34 billion market cap increase,” Hindenburg alleged.

Hindenburg Research has established a short position in Carvana shares, projecting serious concerns regarding the company's financial practices and future viability.
newTitle: Hindenburg Research Accuses Carvana of $800 Million Loan Misconduct
